definition: to rush like ducks (idiom); the mob scrabbles madly for sth unobtainable/an unruly crowd on a wild goose chase
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: Investors rush to it, then it is those countless resort.
sentences.chinese: 投資者對它趨之若鶩，到後來，卻是割肉者無數。

sentences.english: Young Chinese follow Kaifu Lee`s every move.
sentences.chinese: 李開復，中國的年輕人對其一舉一動都趨之若鶩。

sentences.english: Roger in his pre-sentence before execution so that people are flocking towards the sea.
sentences.chinese: 羅傑，他在臨刑前的一句話讓人們趨之若鶩奔向大海。

sentences.english: In neighbouring Bangladesh, eclipse watchers came out in droves.
sentences.chinese: 在鄰近的孟加拉國，月食觀察家出來趨之若鶩。

definition: proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
more and more emerge/innumerable succession/breeding like flies (idiom)
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
